segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: Firstly, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

segments.en: This is the first kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching …

segments.pli: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo … pe … paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhīti.

segments.en: This is the second kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho … pe … anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassāti.

segments.en: This is the third kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.
This is the fourth kind of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurtures happiness.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puññābhisandā kusalābhisandā sukhassāhārā”ti.
segments.en: These are the four kinds of overflowing merit, overflowing goodness that nurture happiness.”

suttaplex.blurb: The four factors of stream-entry—with ethics as the fourth—are streams of merit.
